fields.description:
h3. Summary
The IP addresses of our new mail server are missing from Atlassian Cloud SPF record (_spf.atlassian.net). One of the sample is:
* 52.24.176.31

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://mxtoolbox.com/spf.aspx
# Run the check for atlassian.net
# _spf.atlassian.net will return the following results:
#* https://mxtoolbox.com/SuperTool.aspx?action=spf%3aatlassian.net&run=toolpage

h3. Expected Results
52.24.176.31 is included

h3. Actual Results
52.24.176.31 is not included
fields.summary: IP addresses missing from Atlassian SPF record

fields.description:
An evaluator in [PA-49815 .|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PA-49815]just flagged this with me.

He could see [the page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Defining+a+project] that the link at the bottom of [this page's|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-software/start-a-software-project-937185129.html] instructions directs to, but since the name of the page has changed, he wasn't sure if "Configuring projects" was the right page to click, when the previous page title was "Defining a project".
fields.summary: Link in "Getting Started Guide" > "Start a software project" needs update, updated page title has changed
Global Card Layout Setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers require a custom field to set the user's gender pronouns.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a field to specify the user's gender pronouns.

h3. Workaround
There's currently no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Create field for gender pronouns on profile

fields.description:
h2. h2. Story

As a Jira user I would like to be able to change the visual appearance of Jira to a Dark theme, so that my eyes don't cook after staring at Jira all day. 
h2. h2. Details 
h3. h3. Objective

It would be nice to enhance the usability of Jira by reducing eye strain, and creating visual cohesion with the new Mac OS [mojave|https://www.apple.com/macos/mojave-preview/] coming up later this fall. 
h3. h3. Visual Changes 

The general dark mode convention is to change all current white space to something dark and neutral, similar to #424242, have any selection areas as a lighter neutral like #F8FAF8, and the highlights to maintain a more tradition blue like #549EFF. 

Text would change from a dark grey/black to a white/eggshell color for readability.
fields.summary: Dark mode

fields.description:
When creating a user in the *User management*, the domain of the email address is automatically picked up and the *Self signup* option pops up with the domain, regardless of what is configured in the *Site access* settings (see attachment).

This causes site-admins to accidentaly allowing users of these domains to sign up without invitation if they're not careful.

Site-admins should be able to turn this "auto domain picker" function off or on at will to avoid such incidents.
fields.summary: Toggle auto domain picker when inviting users

fields.description:
On the text fields of Jira issues the shortcuts for bold and insert link are overwriting the MacOS shortcuts.

In Jira the shortcut for bold text is ctrl+b but in Mac, the ctrl+b is used to delete the line.

In Jira the shortcut for insert link is ctrl+k but in Mac, the ctrl+k is used to move the selection one character back

Reference for Mac shortcuts: https://support.apple.com/en-us/ht201236
fields.summary: Jira shortcuts are overwriting MacOS shortcuts for text fields

fields.description:
On the [Managing your workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-your-workflows-776636587.html] doc, there is a step missing under the _Associating a workflow scheme with a project_ section. 

It should be:
# Choose the Jira icon (, , , or ) > Projects.
# Select the title of the desired project > Settings
# Click Workflows. You'll see which workflow scheme the project currently uses.
# Click Switch Scheme and select the relevant workflow scheme from the Scheme list. 
# Click Associate to begin the migration process. Each issue needs to have a valid status, so you may need to assign statuses to a select number of issues after you switch workflow schemes.
fields.summary: editing workflows doc - missing step

fields.description: On [Manage application access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-application-access-744721629.html], "Application Access" from the site administration panel has been renamed to "Product Access" and should be reflected in the documentation.
fields.summary: "Product Access" on Application Access Page
Add BitBucket Cloud to list of projects in Atlassian Jira.

fields.description:
If a credit payment fails, there is only the option to add a new payment card.
A retry payment option would be better as it is not clear how to retry the payment with the same credit card.
fields.summary: Add pay now option

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Issue macro does not show as linked on Jira issue view whenever this macro is used within a macro of static macro type

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Confluence page, add a macro of a static macro type (such as "Numbered Headings macro" or "noprint macro"); 
# Add a Jira issue Macro within the above macro

h3. Expected Results
Confluence page link is displayed on Jira issue screen.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence page link is not displayed on Jira issue screen. 
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No workaround so far.
fields.summary: Jira Issue macro does not show as linked on Jira issue view whenever this macro is used within a macro of static macro type
Polaris Vision Announcement
Polaris Vision Announcement
New feature RAMA

fields.description: If there is a movable "search" button, we can open the result navigator in a new tab, so that we can return to the page before searching more quickly and efficiently.
fields.summary: There should be a movable "search" button within the searching function

fields.description: Atlassian's main color blue is not suit for the menu bar, for example, the left side one in Bitbucket. Its effect is distracting, depressive and also decreesing the attraction of the other components. Github-like neutral color scheme is preferable.
fields.summary: Enable to change the main color to the neutral one not blue

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to bulk update group memberships of users from the application itself. REST API calls can be made but they REST endpoints may change anytime and such solutions need constant updates.

 

There should be a way for customers, especially large scale ones, to do a bulk update or group memberships on cloud sites.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update group memberships of users

fields.description: Atlassian Cloud users are looking to have a login link directly on atlassian.com, similar to the one that is available on bitbucket.org.
fields.summary: Add Cloud login button from main website -  atlassian.com

fields.description:
Currently, we don't have a field to set project status like whether it is a active project or inactive project.

If you implement this feature in Jira cloud it would be great help.
fields.summary: Need a column like Active or inactive list in Projects Module

fields.description:
*As an* administrator user *I can* control who can create versions *so* the version namespace doesn't get poluted with invalid versions when people mistype in Fix Version

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Users with the Create Versions permission will be able to create versions in the way that it is done currently, typing into Fix Version or editing releases on the Releases screen.
 * Users without the Create Versions permission will be able to browse existing releases on the Releases screen and in Fix Version will be able to select an existing version but not create a new one.
fields.summary: As an administrator user I can control who can create versions

fields.description:
This logo should be editable. We are using Service Desk to help support external customers and they are very confused when confronted with this sign in page with Atlassian logo and not our company's logo.

!image-2018-05-29-11-59-57-546.png!
fields.summary: The sign on page's Atlassian logo should be changeable and customized to each company's own logo.

fields.description:
For customers who have sensitive data that needs to be capture on a daily or weekly basis, a process could be put in place to have backups of this production instance available at constant intervals eg : 
 # Weekly Basis up to eg 5 iterations behind
 ## Total there will be at any time 5 instances of the production instance - with each one being at one date eg Instance_WeekN-5 , Instance_WeekN-4, Instance_WeekN-3.. upto Instance_WeekN_1
 # This can also be done on a monthly or daily aspect 

This can be an additional chargeable feature that customer can wish to have to be able to fall back if needed to any older data without creating backup dump. It would be useful if every Atlassian Cloud user has a pre-production instance like above to carry out some testing by our Atlassian Partners as well, or allow easy restoration of deleted spaces for Confluence in case there is a cases where space was deleted unintentionally.
fields.summary: Allow Pre-production instance for Cloud Customers functionality if needed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 

At the moment, there are occasions where integration between Cloud application (Jira or Confluence) with a Server application through application link is not working due to connection issue, such as:
* When creating the application link
* Application link created, but development tools are still not working correctly

Most of the time, IP ranges and domain whitelisting is required, as described in:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/link-to-server-apps-from-cloud-744721656.html

h3. Suggested Solution
It'd be helpful if there is a tool that can check if whitelisting is required

h3. Why this is important
If customers can perform this check without creating a ticket with Atlassian, it could help reduce the amount of time required for troubleshooting, or even the need to create a support ticket
fields.summary: Provide a tool to check if connection between Cloud application and a Server application is blocked

fields.description:
Currently major version upgrades are applied without notice and there is no possibility to avoid it.

If there are major version upgrades which eg. are massively changing the UX and workflows I'm used to I don't want it to be applied automatically. I want to get thing done and updates like the new Jira experience are just disturbing my work.

I'm happy to see overall improvements and it might be better if starting from scratch with Jira but if you are used to older Jira versions you would be much faster to get things done without the new experience you did not opt for.

As I can see here you still have the top menu bar here and this does not match the 'eat you own dogfood' policy a Jira employee has been advertised on a JAX conference a few years ago. If you don't use it yourself don't use your paying customers as laboratory animals!
fields.summary: As a User, I want to control major version upgrades

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you configure an Email Request Type on Jira Service Desk, add a 3rd field, try to set it as required and then click on Update button, the system is not showing up any message saying that this operation is not valid or anything like it, it just does nothing and we don't know if the field was updated or not. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Request Type to open an issue by email.
# Edit fields of this request type.
# Add a new field
# Change the required to yes, in the field you just added, and click on update.

h3. Expected Results

When you try to add a 3rd field as required and click on update, it should show a message saying that it's not possible to set another field as required using Email Request Type, since we can't specify the values for any other fields besides Summary and Description when we're opening an issue by email.

h3. Actual Results

When you add a 3rd field, set it as required and click on update the system doesn't return anything, you click and nothing happens.

h3.Workaround
N/A.
fields.summary: Update button is not showing any message when you try to set a 3rd field as required on an Email Request Type.
CertsAble

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the self sign up setting screen, when selecting the option *Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join:* you must type the domain name and press <enter> or <space> after that. If you don't press either one of those keys and hit *Save changes*, the page will say the changes were saved but if you reload the page it will be back to its initial state without the new domain added.

h3. Suggested Solution
* When clicking on *Save changes*, automatically get the domain from the text box, if the user didn't press <enter> or <space>.
* The page should Inform the user he must press one of those keys for the domain to be inserted.

h3. Workaround
Press <enter> or <space> after typing the domain name
fields.summary: Improve self sign up settings screen

fields.description: Site outage, slow performance and 503 error being reported by users.
fields.summary: Instance performance degraded. 503 and 504 errors reported
Unauthorized user accessed JIRA
Aset

fields.description: At this moment, Jira uses the user's e-mail as the default value for the Full Name. As an Admin, I want to be able to set Jira to use the user's username to populate the user Full Name.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want Jira to use usernames for the user default Full Name
CORS issue when trying to get HTTP GET Request

fields.description: Is known that the Atlassian partners create instances for the customers with the purpose to help these customers during the evaluation and configuration of the application. It would be useful if these partners haven't the limitation on the notifications during the evaluation period, to not impact they demonstration and configuration of the application.
fields.summary: Allow instances created by Atlassian partners to have unlimited notifications during evaluation

fields.description:
Bitbucket pipelines should allow the user to define their own deployment name (and not just test/staging/prod).

For example, we have multiple prod deployments which we manage (different customer sites).
fields.summary: Allow different deployments names

fields.description: Some customers could have a high number of apps (add-on) installed in his instance. Would be useful if the Jira have a statics of usage of those apps in case the customer needs to evaluate continuing using the app or if the Jira administration was changed for some reason.
fields.summary: Statistics of the usage of apps
Allow Users to have an all upper case Atlassian account e-mail address

fields.description:
Currently when changing the current e-mail to an all uppercase e-mail address in id.atlassian.com, it automatically sends the confirmation to the wright e-mail, but once the confirmation is made, the e-mail is converted to a regular all lower case e-mail. Some customers would like to have the ability to maintain an all upper case e-mail addres.

Remarks on this:

_We also have another scenario where the email address will not reach customer inbox unless the exact case is met. Customers would like to cater for this scenario as well._
fields.summary: Allow Users to have a combination of  upper case and lower case Atlassian account e-mail address

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 28 February 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. We don't have any plans to support renaming app users in the foreseeable future. We currently use the app's name as the publicly visible name for these users, and we want to ensure consistency in how apps are represented in our products.

We appreciate your feedback. It's key to helping us understand how we can continue improving your experience with our products. 

Kind regards,
Dave Meyer
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}

As an administrator, I would like to be able to at least change the display name/profile picture of a system / add-on user.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to Change System User's Display Name
Login Issues

fields.description:
When attempting to bulk delete all issues, I was unable to do so. I had selected all issues, including subtasks, 'normal' issues, and epics. Bulk deletion failed with no explanation.

When trying to delete in chunks, it became clear that it was epics that were unable to be deleted because, presumably, the children had not yet been deleted. I was able to delete everything in chunks, as long as the epics were the last chunk. The error when bulk deletion failed was a general error telling me to check the logs, which obviously I can not do as a cloud user.

Solution? Up to you :) Either navigate parent/children in bulk delete and see if all children are present, or just a more useful error message would suffice.

 

Many thanks,

Mitch.
fields.summary: Bulk issue deletion fails when epic and all children selected

fields.description:
Display “Time Tracking” and “Issue links” in the old Jira issue View

fields.summary: Display “Time Tracking” and “Issue links” in the old Jira issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to try additional products in the *Discover applications* menu

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the User Management of the instance
# Go to the *Discover applications* menu at the left corner
# Click 'Trial' in the product that you're looking to try

h3. Expected Results
The product is properly activated in the instance

h3. Actual Results
The activating fails with an *Uh oh. That didn't work...* error and the button gets disabled showing "Activating..."
 
h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Trying additional products are failing and getting stuck in "Activating"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the development field is present in Jira Cloud, however, the value doesn't show up on REST API. This is present on Jira Server. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add this to the REST API response.
fields.summary: I would like the "development" field to be included in the Jira Cloud REST API

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update - 19 April|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We granted access to the ports *8060* and *8085*, the default ports used on Fisheye/Crucible and Bamboo respectively.

Therefore, we will update this improvement request and set as resolved, but feel free to share any thoughts and comments regarding this topic.
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We have already granted access to the ports: 7990, 8090, 8080, 8443

We are now proceeding granting access to the standard ports for other Atlassian products (the ones mentioned in [Changing port that your Atlassian application listens on - Atlassian Documentation)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/changing-port-that-your-atlassian-application-listens-on-834000041.html]

Specifically:
 - 8060 for FishEye/Crucible
 - 8085 for Bamboo{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As per our [Restricted functions in Atlassian Cloud apps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/restricted-functions-in-atlassian-cloud-apps-744721664.html] article, there is a port restriction for external application links, which include the ports *80* and *443* (HTTP and HTTPS respectively), and the *8443*, *7990* and *8090*(the standard ports for Bitbucket and Confluence server)
h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the number of ports which can be used in the Application Links.
h3. Why this is important

Allowing the customers to use different ports is important as it provides more flexibility in the configuration process.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Increase the number of possible ports which can be used in the Application Links

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If the [IP range|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] is changed, the Application Links (used to integrate Jira Cloud with Server products, such as Bitbucket, Crucible, Bamboo) might stop working.

h3. Suggested Solutions
The customers must have a prior communication before any change in order to be able to whitelist the new IP's on their firewalls, avoiding such problems.
fields.summary: Prior public communication before making changes in the IP range

fields.description:
Hopefully this is the right place to raise a new feature modification.

The other day one of our users accidentally changed an Epic to a Story which deleted all of the Stories within.

On the Jira Mobile app this is extremely easy to do and no warning is being given, in this particular case the end user actually said this happened while the device was in their pocket. Yes it may have been unlocked but either way it shouldn't be a matter of two taps and no confirmation warning to do this as a huge amount of work was lost.

It's not this simple to do this in the web app so I don't see why it is in the mobile app. Not having a grumble, just think it would be a good security feature to have!

Many thanks
fields.summary: Add warning when changing Epic to Story in Jira mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Atlassian Home, the _Recent_ section on the History menu is showing deleted content, even of it was deleted manually or wipe out all the instance.

Steps to Reproduce

# Check an issue that is showing in the Recent section of the history menu;
# Access this issue and delete it;

h3. Expected Results

The issue should no longer appear in the recent.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is still showing in the recent.

h3. Notes 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Deleted content still showing in Recent menu in the Atlassian Home

fields.description:
"Hey guys,

I am developer at Taroko Software and jira user. We are currently running your cloud version of the platform and I have just noticed that I can see your redux store through redux-devtools. I am not sure if you guys are aware of it or not, I just wanna inform you.

Regards,
Sam"

By Samuel (samuel.zaza@tarokosoftware.com)
fields.summary: As a developer, I can see your redux store through redux-devtools

fields.description:
As a reviewer of pull requests in Bitbucket Cloud, I would like to be able filter the list of files, on-the-fly, in the Overview (diff) view.  There are two scenarios where this would be particularly useful:
 * On large diffs, when we see the message: "Oops! You've got a lot of code in this diff and it couldn't load with the page."  Using the filter would allow us to review files in smaller groups, such as by project or folder
 * For pull requests where there are many files containing generated code, we may not want to review those changes, so it feels like noise.  At those times, it would be very handy to, hide all files with "Generated" in the path (as an example).

Based on those two cases, I would expect a text box for the filter criteria, and options to either show or hide the matched files.  It may also be handy to specify whether to match any part of the path or just the file name.
fields.summary: Filter Files in Pull Request Diffs in BitBucket Cloud

fields.description:
With that the current design it is expected that emails show a Via field. 
This is contradictory between products (Statuspage and confluence/jira). 

Please can you consider implementing the changes in Jira / Confluence to have a unified product experience.
fields.summary: Email on behalf of our domain have "via" in the From Section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The only way a user can leave a Cloud instance is if the site-admin removes the user from the Cloud instance. In the event that the site-admin is no longer available (left the company for example), the users have no way to leave the Cloud instance on their own.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users the ability to leave the Cloud instance, or delete their user account from the Cloud instance
fields.summary: Have ability to leave Cloud instance/delete own user account from Cloud instance

fields.description:
SUGGESTION: Please force a "Yes/No" modal if "close browser/ browser tab" is clicked while a Create Issue Window is open

STEPS
1. In any Jira project, open any type of "Create Issue" ticket entry window
2. Attempt to close the browser window or tab while the ticket entry window has no text or options selected

RESULT
The browser window or tab closes.

EXPECTED
To prevent accidental user error from deleting a ticket entry's contents, please create a "Yes/No" modal to appear when the user attempts to close a browser window/ tab while the ticket contains empty text fields or unselected options.
fields.summary: Please force a "Yes/No" modal if "close browser/ browser tab" is clicked while a Create Issue Window is open

fields.description:
There is a requirement within projects that I create to have project level configuration for auto assign.

As it exists, if a Project Lead and Default assignee is assigned, all issues created (Story, Bug, etc) are assigned to that one person for action. Alternatively, if a default assignee is configured in the Components, then the issue is auto assigned to that person for action.

This potentially causes an issue for our test team who are busy triaging bugs that arrive but also have lots of other issue types assigned to them, even if just to reassign to the Product or Development Mgr.

 

Proposed Solution

-----------------------------------------

Add a section to the project settings where if required a project administrator can configure which user to assign to fr that specifc issue type.

The workflow would probably run like:

Is an Issue Type specific assignee configured?

Yes, assign to that person

No, Is a Component level person configured?

Yes, assign that person

No (or no component is configured), Is a Default Project assignee configured?

Yes, assign to that person

No, leave as Unassigned.
fields.summary: As a USER, I wish to be able to configure the auto assign settings per Issue Type at a project level

fields.description:
If you access *yourinstance.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?page=1&selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all*, it is possible to navigate in the application, although you are not logged in.

It won't be possible to access any content. But yet, it may definitely concern the customers.

It should require authentication.

fields.description:
Some suggestions for the Cloud team:
 * Improved visibility of errors/logging when attempting server-to-cloud imports
 * Suggested actions for errors encountered when for server-to-cloud imports
 * Sandbox Cloud environment to run and verify uploads before applying to real environment
 ** Would allow uploads without affecting existing Cloud services
 ** Allows end-users prepare processes around migration from server to Cloud (i.e. allow multiple runs of the upload, with the ability to reset/dispose of the sandbox environment once confirmed)
 ** Useful to report potential user/group issues following upload in relation to existing Cloud services (i.e. Jira upload will overwrite Confluence users and groups)
fields.summary: Improved visibility of errors/logging when attempting server-to-cloud imports

fields.summary: Create independent projects

fields.description:
The error message when transitioning one issue on the Kanban board, either by drag and dropping or by selecting the workflow on the Status menu, and a workflow condition fails is not informative, as the user does not get to know what field condition is failing.
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-21 at 13.33.42.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-02-21 at 13.35.25.png|thumbnail! 

The error message should have an informative message which would state "a condition verification failed for field <Field Name>" so the user can take a look at the particular field value and correct it.
fields.summary: As a user, I want more meaningful error messages for workflow condition errors
User 'support2061488744' doesn't have the 'Assign Issues' permission

fields.description:
Are using the Atlassian cloud with great pleasure and are enjoying the new look and feel. 

We are currently using Jira software, Confluence, Stride, Servicedesk, Portfolio, Bitbucket and are anxiously waiting for the new Atlassian Home application. 

There are a few improvements we would like to see:
 * There is no easy way to switch between all these applications. In some of these applications you can create a workaround by manually creating links in the submenu but this is far from ideal and is not possible everywhere. When in the admin area there is a way to switch apps, we would like to see this feature in all the applications as well. In Jira you can customize the list op applications that appear which some people will love but this list does nog appear on all the other applications. We need a unified way to switch between all the applications we are using.
 * The look & feel settings have been reduced to 2 colour and a logo. We prefer to have a few more colours but appreciate starting the new Jira experience with a clean slate. However the look & feel settings are not used across all our applications. We like our users to have a unified look & feel across all our applications. We do not need seperate look & feel setting for each application. 

It seems logical to move some setting like navigation, look & feel, admin etc. to the Atlassian Cloud level so they are used over all applications instead of the Jira level.

Another thing we woul like to see improved is being able to see our Bitbucket instances and users from the general admin area. This way we can manage application access to Bitbucket from the same place as our other applications. But again moving user management to the Atlassian cloud level would probably be a necessary step.

-
fields.summary: Holistic navigation and look & feel settings

fields.description: On the new interface, selecting 'Block Quote' creates a paragraph quote and selecting 'Paragraph Quote' creates a block quote in the JIRA editor Style dropdown.
fields.summary: When on JIRA editor Style drop-down, selecting 'Block Quote' creates a paragraph quote and selecting 'Paragraph Quote' creates a block quote

fields.description: We would like to be able to customize the /home/notifications page, to show specific information in the best design and appearance we want.
fields.summary: Customize the Home Notifications Page

fields.description:
At present, enabling SAML integration using Identity Manager applies to all accounts at the point of configuration.

In addition, the SAML configuration has to be configured in the source and destination at the same time.

This leads to the following:
 * Migration to use SAML for existing Cloud instances requires deployment out-of-hours to minimise disruption.
 * A separate site-admin account, under a different domain, is recommended for disaster recovery
 * Configuration in the Identity Provider and Atlassian Cloud must be configured at the same time, extending the period for user outage.

Feature Request:

Enable Canary Releasing for SAML rollout through selective application for individual user accounts, prior to full rollout.

This would provide the following:
 * Ability to configure SAML authentication in Atlassian Cloud and the IDP, *before* enabling it.
 * Provide the following options for SAML integration:
 ** Disabled (whilst allowing configuration to be edited)
 ** Named - SAML is enabled for specific named users only, allowing phased rollout
 ** Enabled - SAML is enabled for all users
fields.summary: Support Canary release for SAML integration

fields.description: It would be really nice, as repository manager, to have one or more reviewers take a look at a case rather than just assigning one person to the task. This would permit better triage than we have at present. I would see this being anyone on the team or with access to the issue tracker and repository. Rather like Pull Request reviewers. Same basic concept but earlier in the development process.
fields.summary: Add Reviewers to Issues

fields.description:
In an effort to save G Suite user id's, sometimes, the users might want to use a Google Group email address for a non-G Suite user to be authenticated for sites where the Google integration already exists. 

For example, the user has an email with the same domain as the G Suite users of the application, but has no password, as it's not "real" G Suite user.
fields.summary: Integration with Google Groups Email

fields.description:
Report of high memory usage when using the new JIRA experience with Microsoft edge.

Memory reported anywhere between 300MB per tab to 1.6GB per tab as seen in the screenshot provided.
fields.summary: High memory usage in new JIRA Experience with Microsoft Edge.

fields.description: Scratch earlier comments, it seems that there is a bug with a few of our projects rendering the edit function inaccessible for closed tickets.
fields.summary: Allow for issue edits even after tickets are closed
Incident Type required to submit Jira Task. Each new task, story etc the system is showing an error requireing incident type even if the incident type box is not appearing.
&ltb&gt<b>&LTb&GT<b>&#60b&#62&#34

fields.description:
I was recently looking to get a web connector for Jira to tableau.

The pricing for 1-10 was very reasonable and within my budget, however apparently you have to buy a licence for all users. We have ~150 users.

I only needed this for about 7 users so it would have costs me about $300 per month vs $5 against my real need.

Im sure this must apply to plenty of companies, that the use case for a given tool may only apply to a small sub set i.e. managers generating reports.

A way to apply a license to a specific user would be very helpful, and likely mean that more applications could be sold through marketplace.
fields.summary: Allow marketplace product licenses to limit the number of users they apply to.
design net banking integrate
design net banking integrate
Allow slack bot answer in thread

fields.description:
When sending emails via SendGrid the domain 201701confluence.atlassian.net is used as a sender. 

{code:none}
Authentication-Results: spf=none (sender IP is 168.245.48.17)
smtp.mailfrom=201701confluence.atlassian.net; arivale.com; dkim=pass
(signature was verified) header.d=atlassian.net;arivale.com; dmarc=permerror
action=none header.from=arivale.atlassian.net;
Received-SPF: None (protection.outlook.com: 201701confluence.atlassian.net
does not designate permitted sender hosts)
{code}


This causes issues as 201701confluence.atlassian.net does not have a valid SPF record:

{code:bash}
$ dig -t txt 201701confluence.atlassian.net @8.8.8.8 +multiline +short
"wildcard-placeholder"
$ dig -t txt 201701confluence.atlassian.net @9.9.9.9 +multiline +short
"wildcard-placeholder"
$ dig -t txt 201701confluence.atlassian.net @208.67.222.222 +multiline +short
"wildcard-placeholder"
{code}
fields.summary: SPF for 201701confluence.atlassian.net is not set.

fields.description:
I have users that have asked for the URL be highlighted instead of the title text. Is this possible? 

[link title|[http://example.com|http://example.com/]]

I know it seems trivial but it is a pain point for a few of our teams.
fields.summary: Improve Hyperlink Behavior

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As of now users of Jira does not have the function of saving the settings and moving the saved settings to another instance
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a function whereby the settings of Jira can be saved and transferred if a new instance is being created
h3. Why this is important

It would save users a lot of time and hassle if they could just copy the old setting from the previous Jira to a new Jira instance
fields.summary: Saving Jira Default Settings

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Jira-Only Users are not re-directly directly to Jira when try to access confluence. Although the page informs that the user is not authorized to use confluence.

Once on this page, these Jira-Only Users are unable to use the Application Navigator to manually switch to Jira
Environment
h2. Steps to Reproduce

As a Jira-Only user, log into an Atlassian Cloud Instance and try to access Confluence.
Use the Application Switcher to move from Confluence to Jira.
h2. Expected Results

Application Switcher/Navigator drops down and presents an option for Jira
h2. Actual Results

HTTP 500 Error within Browser Console:
{code:java}
Keyframe rule ignored due to bad selector.

{code}
h2. Notes

This does not appear to affect users who are licensed for both JIRA and Confluence
h2. Workaround

Manually navigate to Jira by modifying the URL: https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/

fields.description:
It is not possible to edit an issue's description that is a link if that link spans multiple lines. Tapping on any part of the description launches the link in Safari. Tapping below the link adds an attachment.

If the link spans a single line, you can tap to the right of it to edit the description. If there is other text in the description, that can be tapped to edit the description.
fields.summary: iOS mobile app won't let user change description if it only contains a multi-line link

fields.description:
When generating a backup for Confluence or Jira, the same will be generated as a ".zip" consisted of folders (for attachments, for example) and also, the "entities.xml" and "exportDescriptor.properties" file that will replicate/make the application content to be generated into a new one.

For the users, it would be pretty useful if we could see the content of the backup in a offline method, through one specific file. This is a suggestion to have an option to make the XML backup to be user-viewable (like in the UI).
fields.summary: User-Viewable Backup

In the JIRA sceen require a collapsing screens for differnt groups. For example, If Developement team needs to raise a bug only development teams feilds needs to be expanded rest all department bugs needs to be collapsed(In the same screen)

Thank you!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users invated to instance can see all other users on the same instance through **.atlassian.net/home/people*.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add user to instance;
 # Log in through the new user;
 # access **.atlassian.net/home/people*.

h3. Expected Results

User only able to see other users using the same email domain or those it collaborated with recently.
h3. Actual Results

User can see all users on the instance.

fields.description:
hi Support team,

Is there a easy way to migrate all our projects of >JIRA, Service Desk and  Bitbucket?

Or do we get support for the migration?
fields.summary: Migration from Server to Atlassian Cloud
I want to create a bug

fields.description:
Currently changes resulting from amended commits or other history manipulation are not show as changes to the pull request.

I have a pull request with a single commit. That commit was amended to fix a spelling error and linting issues. The reviewer has had to look over the entire pull request to ensure nothing else has changed, where they just wanted to see the most recent change.

Having an activity added to the activity log "UPDATED by amending 1 commit 5 minutes ago" potentially with a link to show the diff between the old and new version of the PR would make this process a lot more friendly, without having to change our git workflow.
fields.summary: Show amended commits as changes in Pull Request activity log for Bitbucket

fields.description:
As an Atlassian Cloud customer, I use Jira and Confluence and receive StatusPage alerts. When a service on Atlassian Cloud that I don't use, such as BitBucket, has issues, I do not need to receive StatusPage alerts for that service.

I would like my StatusPage alerts to take into consideration what services I have enabled on Atlassian Cloud and only send me notification for those services. The benefit would be to reduce the amount of alert email in my inbox that are irrelevant to me.

*What happened:*

BitBucket had degraded performance on 9th January 2018 that resulted in hourly notification email being sent to my inbox for 6 hours or so.

*What I would have expected:*

As I do not have BitBucket enabled, I would have expected not to receive those alerts.
fields.summary: StatusPage alert selection for Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
1) Preview text should show what will be rendered; currently not matching for h tags

2) Request you revert to the "old" rendered styles for H tags as they were more impactful and useful. Current styles (esp h2 and h3) too closely match regular bold text to be useful. (And the extra giant spaces _above_ the text is not in-line with how these headings are used. My 2 cents ;-)

 

!image-2018-01-09-13-07-07-144.png!
fields.summary: Preview and the Rendered text should be the same size

fields.description:
Background:  I am moving from the Atlassian self-hosted products to the Cloud-based products.

While using the Atlassian cloud products, I have noticed the the navigation menu is either inaccessibly located or not visible across all our cloud products.  For example, Jira and Tempo do have the links menu, but it is located at the bottom of the left pane.  Stride and Bitbucket do NOT have the links menu. 

In addition, some products have confusing names or no name listed at the top.For example, Jira and Stride don't have any name - just the icon and a link to the project list.  Bitbucket does have the product name.  Tempo has "Jira Software" as the title - it should be "Tempo" or "Tempo Timesheets", "tracking", etc.

PROPOSED SOLUTION:
 # Move "Links" menu up, just below the product icon.  A navigation menu is almost universally located near the top of the page, and people are both expecting it to be there and get lost when it's not.
 # Add "Links" menu to all cloud-based products and link them across all the other purchased/subscribed products.
 # Consistently label the product names in each product.

The problem I am experiencing is training new employees as well as employees who are familiar with the server-based offerings. 

New employees are already overwhelmed by the sheer size of the Atlassian suite of products, and are not skilled enough to know where they are.  One employee, for example, went into Bitbucket and entered all his Stories as Issues, which clearly is wrong.  Another employee was frustrated because they knew they _wanted_ to switch from one product to another, but could not find a navigation menu to assist and ended up clicking haphazardly through his history during a training session with the team.

Existing employees are also frustrated by the perception of a poorly constructed cloud offering, which they are being forced to use, when the server-based product had none of these core design issues.

 

NOTE: Please ignore the attached image file names, they are incorrect.
fields.summary: Navigation menu needs to move to top of the page and be integrated across all Atlassian cloud offerings, and each offering should display the correct product name
